db:abstract.db:para: The TouchPoint class provides information about a touch point in a QTouchEvent.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.6.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] TouchPoint::TouchPoint(QTouchEvent::TouchPoint &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-constructs a TouchPoint instance, making it point to the same object that other was pointing to.

db:section.db:title: QTouchEvent::TouchPoint::InfoFlags TouchPoint::flags() const
db:section.db:para: Returns additional information about the touch point.

db:section.db:title: int TouchPoint::id() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the id number of this touch point.
Do not assume that id numbers start at zero or that they are sequential. Such an assumption is often false due to the way the underlying drivers work.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::lastNormalizedPos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the normalized position of this touch point from the previous touch event.
The coordinates are normalized to the size of the touch device, i.e. (0,0) is the top-left corner and (1,1) is the bottom-right corner.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::lastPos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the position of this touch point from the previous touch event, relative to the widget or QGraphicsItem that received the event.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::lastScenePos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the scene position of this touch point from the previous touch event.
The scene position is the position in QGraphicsScene coordinates if the QTouchEvent is handled by a QGraphicsItem::touchEvent() reimplementation, and identical to the screen position for widgets.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::lastScreenPos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the screen position of this touch point from the previous touch event.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::normalizedPos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the normalized position of this touch point.
The coordinates are normalized to the size of the touch device, i.e. (0,0) is the top-left corner and (1,1) is the bottom-right corner.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::pos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the position of this touch point, relative to the widget or QGraphicsItem that received the event.

db:section.db:title: qreal TouchPoint::pressure() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the pressure of this touch point. The return value is in the range 0.0 to 1.0.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.0] QVector<QPointF> TouchPoint::rawScreenPositions() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the raw, unfiltered positions for the touch point. The positions are in native screen coordinates. To get local coordinates you can use mapFromGlobal() of the QWindow returned by QTouchEvent::window().

db:note.db:para: Returns an empty vector if the touch device's capabilities do not include QTouchDevice::RawPositions.

Native screen coordinates refer to the native orientation of the screen which, in case of mobile devices, is typically portrait. This means that on systems capable of screen orientation changes the positions in this list will not reflect the current orientation (unlike pos(), screenPos(), etc.) and will always be reported in the native orientation.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: QRectF TouchPoint::rect() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the rect for this touch point, relative to the widget or QGraphicsItem that received the event. The rect is centered around the point returned by pos().

db:note.db:para: This function returns an empty rect if the device does not report touch point sizes.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::scenePos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the scene position of this touch point.
The scene position is the position in QGraphicsScene coordinates if the QTouchEvent is handled by a QGraphicsItem::touchEvent() reimplementation, and identical to the screen position for widgets.

db:section.db:title: QRectF TouchPoint::sceneRect() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the rect for this touch point in scene coordinates.

db:note.db:para: This function returns an empty rect if the device does not report touch point sizes.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::screenPos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the screen position of this touch point.

db:section.db:title: QRectF TouchPoint::screenRect() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the rect for this touch point in screen coordinates.

db:note.db:para: This function returns an empty rect if the device does not report touch point sizes.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::startNormalizedPos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the normalized starting position of this touch point.
The coordinates are normalized to the size of the touch device, i.e. (0,0) is the top-left corner and (1,1) is the bottom-right corner.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::startPos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the starting position of this touch point, relative to the widget or QGraphicsItem that received the event.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::startScenePos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the starting scene position of this touch point.
The scene position is the position in QGraphicsScene coordinates if the QTouchEvent is handled by a QGraphicsItem::touchEvent() reimplementation, and identical to the screen position for widgets.

db:section.db:title: QPointF TouchPoint::startScreenPos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the starting screen position of this touch point.

db:section.db:title: Qt::TouchPointState TouchPoint::state() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current state of this touch point.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D TouchPoint::velocity() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a velocity vector for this touch point. The vector is in the screen's coordinate system, using pixels per seconds for the magnitude.

db:note.db:para: The returned vector is only valid if the touch device's capabilities include QTouchDevice::Velocity.
